oai_dc:dc.dc:title: EXTENSION OF MILD SLOPE EQUATION FOR WAVES PROPAGATING OVER A PERMEABLE SUBMERGED BREAKWATER
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Izumiya, Takashi
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: mild slope
equation extension
wave propagation
breakwater
submerged breakwater
permeable breakwater
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A wave equation is presented for predicting reflected and transmitted waves for a permeable submerged breakwater. This equation includes the mild slope equation derived by Berkhoff(1972), which is a vertically integrated refraction-diffraction equation. Therefore, the equation derived can also predict the combined effects of refraction and diffraction. Numerical calculations with a dissipation term due to breaking are performed to obtain reflection and transmission coefficients as well as wave height distributions. Through the comparisons with the experimental results, the validity of the model is confirmed.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 22 (1990): Proceedings of 22nd Conference on Coastal Engineering, Delft, The Netherlands, 1990.
